verbs.description: Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan [V: will] not deploy National Guard resources to the border until the federal policy of separating children from their families has been rescinded , the governor tweeted Tuesday morning . Further , the governor ordered four crewmembers and a helicopter to return from where they were stationed in New Mexico . The governor tweeted Tuesday morning : " Until this policy of separating children from their families has been rescinded , Maryland will not deploy any National Guard resources to the border . Earlier this morning , I ordered our 4 crewmembers & helicopter to immediately return from where they were stationed in New Mexico . " Under the current policy , all unlawful crossings are referred for prosecution -- a process that moves adults to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service and sends many children to facilities run by the Department of Health and Human Services . Under the Obama administration , such families were usually referred for civil deportation proceedings , not requiring separation . Nearly 2,000 children were separated from their families over a six - week period in April and May. Trump administration officials said adults who try crossing the border illegally are criminals and should be treated as such . The governor tweeted on Monday : " Washington has failed again & again to deliver needed immigration reform - Congress and the administration must step up and work together to fix our broken system . Immigration enforcement efforts should focus on criminals , not separating innocent children from their families . " The Maryland National Guard has participated in southwest border operations several times since 2000 and regularly between 2012 and 2015 , the governor 's office said . Governors in other states have taken similar action , including in Massachusetts , where Republican Gov. Charlie Baker 's administration canceled its plan to send Massachusetts National Guard members and equipment to the southwestern U.S. border . Governors in New York and Rhode Island also are not sending National Guard troops to the border . Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam ordered on Tuesday the recall of four National Guard soldiers and a helicopter from the U.S. border in response to federal government 's enforcement of " zero - tolerance " policy that separates immigrant children from their families , NBC News reported . Speaking Monday , Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings , D - District 7 , said what the Trump administration is doing is extremely dangerous . " President Trump is creating a situation where he 's going to have a lot of young people growing up not liking America and that is dangerous in and of itself , " Cummings said . The Associated Press contributed to this report .

" President Trump is creating a situation where he 's going to have a lot of young people growing up not liking America and that is dangerous in and of itself , " Cummings said . The Associated Press contributed to this report .

Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan will not deploy National Guard resources to the border until the federal policy of separating children from their families has been rescinded , the governor tweeted Tuesday morning . Further , the governor ordered four crewmembers and a helicopter to return from where they were stationed in New Mexico . The governor tweeted Tuesday morning : " Until [ARG1: this policy of separating children from their families] has been [V: rescinded] , Maryland will not deploy any National Guard resources to the border . Earlier this morning , I ordered our 4 crewmembers & helicopter to immediately return from where they were stationed in New Mexico . " Under the current policy , all unlawful crossings are referred for prosecution -- a process that moves adults to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service and sends many children to facilities run by the Department of Health and Human Services . Under the Obama administration , such families were usually referred for civil deportation proceedings , not requiring separation . Nearly 2,000 children were separated from their families over a six - week period in April and May. Trump administration officials said adults who try crossing the border illegally are criminals and should be treated as such . The governor tweeted on Monday : " Washington has failed again & again to deliver needed immigration reform - Congress and the administration must step up and work together to fix our broken system . Immigration enforcement efforts should focus on criminals , not separating innocent children from their families . " The Maryland National Guard has participated in southwest border operations several times since 2000 and regularly between 2012 and 2015 , the governor 's office said . Governors in other states have taken similar action , including in Massachusetts , where Republican Gov. Charlie Baker 's administration canceled its plan to send Massachusetts National Guard members and equipment to the southwestern U.S. border . Governors in New York and Rhode Island also are not sending National Guard troops to the border . Virginia Gov. " Under the current policy , all unlawful crossings are referred for prosecution -- a process that moves adults to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service and sends many children to facilities run by the Department of Health and Human Services . Under the Obama administration , such families were usually referred for civil deportation proceedings , not requiring separation . Nearly 2,000 children were separated from their families over a six - week period in April and May. Trump administration officials said adults who try crossing the border illegally are criminals and should be treated as such . The governor tweeted on Monday : " Washington has failed again & again to deliver needed immigration reform - Congress and the administration [V: must] step up and work together to fix our broken system . Immigration enforcement efforts should focus on criminals , not separating innocent children from their families . " The Maryland National Guard has participated in southwest border operations several times since 2000 and regularly between 2012 and 2015 , the governor 's office said . Governors in other states have taken similar action , including in Massachusetts , where Republican Gov. Charlie Baker 's administration canceled its plan to send Massachusetts National Guard members and equipment to the southwestern U.S. border . Governors in New York and Rhode Island also are not sending National Guard troops to the border . Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam ordered on Tuesday the recall of four National Guard soldiers and a helicopter from the U.S. border in response to federal government 's enforcement of " zero - tolerance " policy that separates immigrant children from their families , NBC News reported . Speaking Monday , Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings , D - District 7 , said what the Trump administration is doing is extremely dangerous . " President Trump is creating a situation where he 's going to have a lot of young people growing up not liking America and that is dangerous in and of itself , " Cummings said . The Associated Press contributed to this report .

" President Trump is creating a situation where he 's going to have a lot of young people growing up not liking America and that is dangerous in and of itself , " Cummings said . The Associated Press contributed to this report .

Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan will not deploy National Guard resources to the border until the federal policy of separating children from their families has been rescinded , the governor tweeted Tuesday morning . Further , the governor ordered four crewmembers and a helicopter to return from where they were stationed in New Mexico . The governor tweeted Tuesday morning : " Until this policy of separating children from their families has been rescinded , Maryland will not deploy any National Guard resources to the border . Earlier this morning , I ordered our 4 crewmembers & helicopter to immediately return from where they were stationed in New Mexico . " Under the current policy , all unlawful crossings are referred for prosecution -- a process that moves adults to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service and sends many children to facilities run by the Department of Health and Human Services . Under the Obama administration , such families were usually referred for civil deportation proceedings , not requiring separation . Nearly 2,000 children were separated from their families over a six - week period in April and May. Trump administration officials said adults who try crossing the border illegally are criminals and should be treated as such . The governor tweeted on Monday : " Washington has failed again & again to deliver needed immigration reform - Congress and the administration must step up and work together to fix our broken system . Immigration enforcement efforts should focus on criminals , not separating innocent children from their families . " The Maryland National Guard has participated in southwest border operations several times since 2000 and regularly between 2012 and 2015 , the governor 's office said . Governors in other states have taken similar action , including in Massachusetts , where Republican Gov. Charlie Baker 's administration canceled its plan to send Massachusetts National Guard members and equipment to the southwestern U.S. border . Governors in New York and Rhode Island also [V: are] not sending National Guard troops to the border . Virginia Gov.
